{{Infobox person | image = | name = Jack Nicholas Pritzker | birth_date = {{Birth date|1904|01|6}} | birth_place = [[Chicago, Illinois]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1979|10|30|1904|01|6}} | death_place = | occupation = attorney and real estate investor | salary = | networth = | education = J.D. [[Northwestern University School of Law]] | spouse = [[Rhoda Pritzker|Rhoda Goldberg]] | parents = Annie P. Cohn
Nicholas J. Pritzker | children = [[Nicholas J. Pritzker]] | family = [[Abram Nicholas Pritzker]] (brother)
[[Harry Nicholas Pritzker]] (brother) | website = | footnotes = | awards = }} '''Jack Nicholas Pritzker''' (January 6, 1904 - October 30, 1979)[http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/477277/Pritzker-family Britannica: "Pritzker family"] retrieved July 21, 2013 was an American businessman and member of the [[Pritzker family]]. ==Early life and education== Jack Pritzker was the son of [[Ukrainians|Ukrainian]] [[Jewish]] immigrants Annie P. (née Cohn) and Nicholas J. Pritzker.{{cite news| url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9B0DE5DB1439F936A15752C0A96F958260&sec=&spon=&pagewanted=all | work=The New York Times | title=Jay Pritzker, Who Built Chain Of Hyatt Hotels, Is Dead at 76 | first=Anthony | last=Ramirez | date=January 25, 1999 | accessdate=April 23, 2010}}[https://books.google.ca/books?id=RowMAQAAMAAJ&q=Annie+Cohn+Pritzker&dq=Annie+Cohn+Pritzker&hl=en] His father left Kiev for Chicago in 1881 and worked first as a pharmacist and then a lawyer.[http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/1988/04/25/70462/index.htm CNN Money: "THE PRITZKERS UNVEILING A PRIVATE FAMILY" By Ford S. Worthy] April 25, 1988 He graduated from [[Northwestern University School of Law]] in 1927.Silbiger, Steve [https://books.google.com/books?id=Qp-kDuWkiAoC&pg=PA33&lpg=PA33&dq=jack+nicholas+pritzker&source=bl&ots=zLPVIlCa_4&sig=_qctMGjGtI_WGyc9m2OYwSufMKM&hl=en&sa=X&ei=E4HsUdmZJvjl4AO1goDYBA&ved=0CEMQ6AEwBDge#v=onepage&q=jack%20nicholas%20pritzker&f=false ''The Jewish Phenomenon: Seven Keys to the Enduring Wealth of a People''] His father wrote a small book that has been passed down from Pritzker to Pritzker; the theme of the book is "Your only immortality is the impact you have on your successors." ==Career== Jack joined his father's law firm, ''Pritzker & Pritzker'', along with his brothers, [[Abram Nicholas Pritzker|Abram]] and [[Harry Nicholas Pritzker|Harry]]. Harry specialized in criminal law, Abram (called Abe and later A. N.) specialized in business law, and Jack in real estate law.[https://www.nytimes.com/1984/02/26/business/how-they-deal-and-multiply.html New York Times: "HOW THEY DEAL AND MULTIPLY" By Marylin Bender] February 26, 1984 In the 1930s, he left the law practice and branched out with his brother Abram investing in real estate and small companies mostly in the [[Chicago]] area. Harry continued to run the law firm which eventually became an in-house firm catering solely to the needs of the Pritzker family and its business. The Pritzker brothers were very successful and amassed a considerable fortune. Using ''Pritzker & Pritzker'', they shielded their earnings from taxes through a series of trusts and tax code loopholes enabling them to distribute their earnings as they chose.[http://www.chicagomag.com/Chicago-Magazine/December-2002/Tremors-in-the-Empire/ Chicago magazine: "Tremors in the Empire" by Shane Tritsch] December 2002 His brother Abram's sons continued to grow the family business eventually buying the [[Hyatt Hotel|Hyatt]] House hotel in [[Los Angeles]] in 1957 forming the cornerstone of their hotel chain. His nephew Robert created a conglomerate of a multitude of manufacturing companies which grew into the multibillion-dollar [[Marmon Group]]. Marmon was diversified to include manufacturing concerns ranging from lumber to railroad box cars and travel industry staples. It composed half of the family's wealth. On December 25, 2007, it was announced that Warren Buffett, through [[Berkshire Hathaway]], would purchase 60% of the Marmon Group from the Pritzkers for $4.5 Billion.[https://www.nytimes.com/2007/12/26/business/26deal.html New York Times: "Rapidly, Buffett Secures a Deal for $4.5 Billion" By VIKAS BAJAJ] December 26, 2007 ==Personal life== Pritzker was married to [[Rhoda Pritzker|Rhoda Goldberg]]; they had one child: [[Nicholas J. Pritzker]] who is chairman of the board and CEO of the Hyatt Development Corporation.[http://www.chicagobusiness.com/article/19990206/ISSUE01/10001555?template=printart Crain's Chicago Business: "TORCH GETS PASSED AT PRITZKERS' MEGA-EMPIRE" by Paul Merrion] February 06, 1999 ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Pritzker, Harry Nicholas}} [[Category:1904 births]] [[Category:1979 deaths]] [[Category:Pritzker family|Jack Nicholas]] [[Category:American people of Ukrainian-Jewish descent]] [[Category:20th-century American businesspeople]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2018}} {{Use British English|date=February 2018}} '''James Duncan Goold, Baron Goold''' (7 February 1923 – 27 July 1997) was a Scottish businessman and [[Scottish Conservative Party|Conservative]] politician.
Educated at the [[The Glasgow Academy|Glasgow Academy]], Goold was a [[chartered accountant]]. He was the Honorary Treasurer of the [[Scottish Conservative Party]] between 1981 and 1983, and its Chairman from 1983 to 1990.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/obituary-lord-goold-1253414.html|title=Obituary: Lord Goold|last=Goldie|first=Annabel|date=30 July 1997|work=|newspaper=The Independent|author-link=Annabel Goldie|access-date=|via=}}</ref>
Goold was [[Knight Bachelor|knighted]] in 1983.<ref>{{London Gazette|date=11 June 1983|issue=49375|page=2|supp=y}}</ref> On 8 April 1987, he was created a [[life peer]], as '''Baron Goold''', of [[Waterfoot, East Renfrewshire|Waterfoot]] in the [[Eastwood, Strathclyde|District of Eastwood]].<ref>{{London Gazette|date=13 April 1987|issue=50888|page=4937}}</ref> He was [[Deputy Lieutenant]] of [[Renfrewshire (historic)|Renfrewshire]] from 1985 to 1994 and [[Lord Lieutenant of Renfrewshire]] from 1994 to 1997.<ref name=":0" />
== References == <references />
== External links == * {{Hansard-contribs|mr-james-goold|Lord Goold}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Goold, James Goold, Baron}} [[Category:1923 births]] [[Category:1997 deaths]] [[Category:Lord-Lieutenants of Renfrewshire]] [[Category:Conservative Party (UK) life peers]] [[Category:Knights Bachelor]] [[Category:Scottish accountants]] [[Category:Scottish businesspeople]] [[Category:People educated at the Glasgow Academy]] [[Category:Scottish Conservative Party politicians]]

{{Infobox person | name = Jay Gould II | image = JayGouldII 01.gif | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date|1888|9|1|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[New York City]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1935|1|26|1888|9|1|mf=y}} | death_place = [[Margaretville, New York]] | occupation = [[Tennis]] player | spouse = Anne Douglass Graham | parents = [[George Jay Gould I]]
[[Edith Kingdon]] | relatives = [[Jay Gould]], grandfather
[[George Gould II]], brother |children=[[Jay Gould III]] }} {{MedalTop}} {{MedalSport | Men's [[jeu de paume]]}} {{MedalCountry | the {{USA}} }} {{MedalGold | [[1908 Summer Olympics|1908 London]] | [[Jeu de paume at the 1908 Summer Olympics|Individual]]}} {{MedalBottom}} '''Jay Gould II''' (September 1, 1888 – January 26, 1935) was an American [[real tennis]] player and a grandson of the railroad magnate [[Jay Gould]]. He was the world champion (1914–1916) and the [[Olympic games|Olympic]] gold medalist (London, 1908, then under the name [[jeu de paume]]). He held the U.S. Amateur Championship title continuously from 1906–1925, winning 18 times (no tournaments were held during the U.S. involvement in World {{nowrap|War I}}).{{cite web| url=http://www.uscourttennis.com/| title=United States Court Tennis Preservation Foundation, Trivia Corner| author=| accessdate=July 26, 2006| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060718095018/http://www.uscourttennis.com/| archivedate=July 18, 2006| df=}} During the same period, he never lost a set to an American amateur, and lost only one singles match, to English champion E.M. Baerlein.Allison Danzig, ''The Racquet Game'' (Macmillan 1930), 66. The court built for him by his father at the family's [[Georgian Court University|Georgian Court]] estate was restored in 2005. Jay {{nowrap|Gould II}} is the great-great-uncle of US Olympic cyclist [[Georgia Gould]], who qualified to race in the London 2012 Olympiad. ==Biography== He was born on September 1, 1888 to [[George Jay Gould I]]. ==Marriage and children== He married Anne Douglass Graham, a cousin of [[Abigail Campbell Kawānanakoa|Princess Abigail Campbell Kawananakoa]] and a granddaughter of a Hawaiian chiefess, and had the following children:{{Cite web | last = | first = |title=The Princess Kawananakoa| work = The Colfax chronicle. (Colfax, Grant Parish, La.) 1877-1981|date = July 22, 1911|publisher= Library of Congress | url = http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn88064176/1911-07-22/ed-1/seq-7/ | accessdate = 9 May 2013 }} *Eleanor Gould, born January 31, 1912, who married successively William N. {{nowrap|Haskill III}} and Ludlow W. Stephens.She married Ludlow W. Stephens on December 26, 1934. *Anne Douglass Gould, born March 5, 1913. She married and divorced Frank Spencer J. Meador, Herman H. Elsbury, Gus Wagoner, Ezra Wogoman, and Donald Valentine. *[[Jay Gould III]] (May 13, 1920 – May 11, 1987). He was a [[lieutenant]] in the [[U.S. Army]] during [[World War II]]. He married [[Jennifer Beryl Bruce]], the daughter of [[Nigel Bruce]], in 1944 and divorced in 1946.{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Divorced |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,793077-2,00.html |quote=Jay Gould III, 26, great-grandson of the late railroad tycoon, still had a wife. Jennifer Bruce Gould, 21, daughter of Cinemactor Nigel Bruce, was refused a divorce by a Los Angeles judge who judged her complaints insufficient. Some of them: Husband Jay wouldn't let her dance or play tennis with anybody but him, didn't like her theatrical friends, demanded full-fashioned meals, and was too demonstrative in his public lovemaking. |work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date=June 17, 1946 |accessdate=2008-08-03 }}{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Married |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,791685,00.html |quote=Navy Air Forces Lieut. Jay Gould III, 24, great-grandson of the late great manipulator Jay Gould; and Jennifer Beryl Bruce, 19, daughter of veteran British character actor Nigel Bruce; in Beverly Hills, Calif. |work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date=September 25, 1944 |accessdate=2008-08-03 }}{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Divorced |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,888276,00.html |quote=Jay Gould III, 27, wartime AAFlyer, namesake and great-grandson of the Erie railroad tycoon; by Jennifer Bruce Gould, 21, pert, pretty daughter of Cinemactor Nigel Bruce; after nearly two years of marriage, one child; in Los Angeles. |work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date=July 22, 1946 |accessdate=2008-08-03 }}{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Wife of Jay Gould III Wins Divorce Decree |quote=Jay Gould III was accused of "indiscreetly" attending a party at a San Francisco hotel with another woman just three months after his marriage to actress ... |work=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=July 9, 1946 }} He next married Blair Roemer Stevens on November 27, 1948.{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Jay Gould 3rd Weds. Marries Mrs. Blair R. Stevens in Westwood, Calif., Church |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1948/11/29/archives/jay-gould-3d-weds-marries-mrs-blair-r-stevens-in-westwood-calif.html |quote=Blair Roemer Stevens, were reported to be at Lake Arrowhead today after their marriage last evening in the village church ... |work=[[New York Times]] |date=November 29, 1948 |accessdate=2008-08-03 }} Gould married a third time on June 30, 1953 to [[Lina Romay (singer)|Lina Romay]], the singer and actress.{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Married |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,806727,00.html |quote=Jay Gould III, 32, namesake and great-grandson of the fabulous railroad financier; and Lina Romay, 29, dark-eyed songstress of stage (''Michael Todd's Peep Show'') and screen (''The Man Behind the Gun''); he for the third time, she for the second; in Los Angeles. |work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date=July 13, 1953 |accessdate=2008-08-03 }}{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Lina Romay Becomes Bride of Jay Gould III |url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/courant/access/887569642.html?dids=887569642:887569642&FMT=CITE&FMTS=CITE:AI&date=Jul+02%2C+1953&author=&pub=The+Hartford+Courant&desc=Lina+Romay+Becomes+Bride+of+Jay+Gould+III&pqatl=google |quote= |work=[[Hartford Courant]] |date=July 2, 1953 |accessdate=2008-08-03 }} ==Death== He died on January 26, 1935, at [[Margaretville, New York]]. The cause of death was "hemorrhage of the esophagus brought on by a complexity of ailments."{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Jay Gould Is Dead. Court Tennis Star. Grandson of the Financier Had Held Championship for Quarter of Century. |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1935/01/28/archives/jay-gould-is-dead-court-tennis-star-grandson-of-the-financier-had.html |quote=Sportsman Succumbs in Up-State Hospital at 46. His Body Brought Here for Funeral. |work=[[New York Times]] |date=January 28, 1935 |accessdate=2007-07-21 }} ==See also== * [[Real tennis world champions]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{LOCFC|jaygould/}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gould, Jay}} [[Category:1888 births]] [[Category:1935 deaths]] [[Category:Gould family|Jay Gould II]] [[Category:American real tennis players]] [[Category:Olympic real tennis players of the United States]] [[Category:Jeu de paume players at the 1908 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Olympic gold medalists for the United States in tennis]] [[Category:Medalists at the 1908 Summer Olympics]]

{{Use British English|date=October 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2014}} {{Spanish name|'''Cabral'''|'''Bermúdez'''}} {{Infobox officeholder |office=City councilman (Santiago) | term_start= 1932 |term_end=1940}} {{Infobox person | name = José Mª. Cabral Bermúdez | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1902|04|13}} | birth_place = [[Santiago de los Caballeros]], [[Dominican Republic]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|1984|05|26|1902|04|13}} | death_place = | death_cause = | body_discovered = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | nationality = [[People of the Dominican Republic|Dominican]] | citizenship = | residence = [[Santo Domingo]] | alma_mater = [[Universidad de Santo Domingo]] (1927) | occupation = Lawyer | home_town = | salary = | net_worth = | height = | weight = | boards = Banco de Reservas | spouse = Mercedes Amalia Vega Batlle | children = María Josefina, José María, Petrica, Marco Buenaventura | parents = [[José María Cabral y Báez]] (father), María Petronila Bermúdez Rochet (mother) | relatives = [[Buenaventura Báez]] (great-grandfather), [[Manuel Díez Cabral]] (grandson), [[Donald Reid Cabral]] (nephew), [[Manuel del Cabral]] (cousin), [[Julio Vega Batlle]] (brother-in-law), [[Juan Bautista Vicini Cabral]] (nephew), [[José León Asensio]] (son-in-law) | callsign = | awards = | module = | footnotes = }} '''José María Cabral Bermúdez''' (1902–1984) was a lawyer and businessman from the [[Dominican Republic]]. Cabral was member of the first [[Military junta|junta]] that ruled the Dominican Republic after the fall of the dictatorship of [[Rafael Trujillo]]. He was born into an [[upper class]] family, and was in his days the most important [[oligarchy|oligarch]] of the Dominican Republic.{{cite book|editor=Institute of Latin American Studies|title=Iberoamericana: Nordic Journal of Latin American and Caribbean Studies, Volúmenes 24-25|date=1994|publisher=Scandinavian Committee for Research on Latin America|page=93|url=https://books.google.com.do/books?id=k6YmAQAAIAAJ&q=Jos%C3%A9+Mar%C3%ADa+%22Cabral+Berm%C3%BAdez%22&dq=Jos%C3%A9+Mar%C3%ADa+%22Cabral+Berm%C3%BAdez%22&hl=es&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwibrtLJmLLLAhUI7SYKHXYtBiU4FBDoAQg9MAg|accessdate=8 March 2016|language=Spanish|quote=En discurso del 18 de diciembre [[Joaquín Balaguer|Balaguer]] anunció la formación de un Consejo de Estado, en el cual participarían, junto a él como presidente, representantes del bando enemigo: [[Rafael Filiberto Bonnelly|Rafael Bonnelly]], como vicepresidente, José María Cabral Bermúdez (jefe de la oligarquía), monseñor Eliseo Pérez Sánchez, Nicolás Pichardo, [[Antonio Imbert Barrera|Antonio Imbert]] y [[Luis Amiama Tió|Luis Amiama]]}} Cabral Bermúdez was vice-president of the [[:es:BanReservas|Reserve Bank of the Dominican Republic]], and member of the administrative council of ''Ingenio Cristóbal Colón'', a sugar company.{{cite book|last1=Hilton|first1=Ronald|title=Who's Who in Latin America: Part VII, Cuba, Dominican Republic and Haiti|date=1951|publisher=Stanford University Press|location=[[Redwood City, California]]|isbn=9780804707572|page=54|url=https://books.google.com.do/books?id=SoqaAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA54&lpg=PA54&dq=Jos%C3%A9+Mar%C3%ADa+%22Cabral+Berm%C3%BAdez%22&source=bl&ots=8y-PiC21QW&sig=GpHuD1mxzA_E83id0MCE11Pw_go&hl=es&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiHz9eRlbLLAhWB1h4KHXtCC9g4ChDoAQhBMAc#v=onepage&q=Jos%C3%A9%20Mar%C3%ADa%20%22Cabral%20Berm%C3%BAdez%22&f=false|accessdate=8 March 2016}} {{ahnentafel |collapsed=yes |align=center |boxstyle_1=background-color: #fcc; |boxstyle_2=background-color: #fb9; |boxstyle_3=background-color: #ffc; |boxstyle_4=background-color: #bfc; |boxstyle_5=background-color: #9fe; | 1= 1. {{Infobox officeholder |honorific-prefix = Dr. Rev. |name = Joyce Rosalind Aryee |honorific-suffix = |image = Dr_Joyce_Aryee.png |imagesize = |smallimage = |alt = |caption = |order = |office = Chief Executive
Ghana Chamber of Mines |term_start = 2001 |term_end = 2011 |president = |predecessor = |successor = |constituency = |majority = |order2 = |office2 = Minister for Local Government |term_start2 = 1987 |term_end2 = 1988 |president2 = [[Jerry Rawlings|Flt. Lt. Rawlings]] |predecessor2 = |successor2 = |majority2 = |order3 = |office3 = Minister for Education |term_start3 = 1985 |term_end3 = 1987 |president3 = [[Jerry Rawlings|Flt. Lt. Rawlings]] |predecessor3 = |successor3 = |majority3 = |order4 = |office4 = Minister for Information |term_start4 = 1982 |term_end4 = 1985 |president4 = [[Jerry Rawlings|Flt. Lt. Rawlings]] |predecessor4 = |successor4 = |constituency4 = |majority4 = |order5 = |office5 = |term_start5 = |term_end5 = |president5 = |predecessor5 = |successor5 = |birth_date = 27 March 1947 |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |restingplacecoordinates = |birthname = |nationality = [[Ghanaian]] |party = |otherparty = |spouse = [[Charles Wereko-Brobby]] (divorced) |partner = |relations = |children = 1 child |residence = |alma_mater = |occupation = |profession = Reverend Minister |cabinet = |committees = |portfolio = |signature = |signature_alt = |website = http://www.saltandlightgh.org |footnotes = |blank1 = |data1 = |blank2 = |data2 = |blank3 = |data3 = |blank4 = |data4 = |blank5 = |data5 = }} '''Joyce Rosalind Aryee''', also known as "Auntie Joyce", is a [[Ghana]]ian former politician, reverend minister and business person. Aryee is recognized for having served [[Ghana]] for more than 40 years in both the public and private sectors. She is the previous Chief Executive Officer of the Ghana Chamber of Mines{{Cite web|url=https://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/NewsArchive/Minister-on-right-course-with-galamsey-directive-Joyce-Aryee-531713|title=Minister on right course with ‘galamsey’ directive - Joyce Aryee|website=www.ghanaweb.com|language=en|access-date=2017-09-29}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.todaygh.com/dr-joyce-rosalind-aryee-first-ceo-ghana-chamber-mines/|title=Dr. Joyce Rosalind Aryee – First CEO of Ghana Chamber of Mines|date=2017-10-13|work=Today Newspaper|access-date=2018-06-12|language=en-US}} and was the first woman in Africa to have held that role. She has also held political roles in Ghana from the early years of the PNDC government. She is currently the Executive Director of Salt and Light Ministries, a para-church organization.{{Cite news|url=http://www.ghananewsagency.org/social/women-of-courage-awards-held--74629|title=Women of Courage Awards held|access-date=2017-09-29}} ==Early life and education== Born to a Fante mother and a Ga father, Aryee is the second of four children. During her early years, Aryee lived with her family in Suntreso, [[Kumasi]] where she started her early years of education at Methodist Primary School and Methodist Middle School. She later went to [[Achimota School]] and graduated from the [[University of Ghana]], Legon with a BA (Hons) in English. Aryee was formerly married to Dr [[Charles Wereko-Brobby]].Gideon Sackitey, [http://www.ghanadot.com/personalities.brobbey.123006.html Dr Charles Wereko-Brobby] ==Career== From 1982 to 1985 Aryee was Minister of Information for the [[PNDC]].Festus Eribo & William Jong-Ebot, ''Press Freedom and Communication in Africa'', 1997, p. 20. From 1985 to 1987 she was Minister of Education, and in 1987–88 Minister of Local Government. From 1988 to 2001 she was Minister of Democracy in the Office of the Prime Minister, and from 1993 to 2001 a Member of the National Defence Council.{{cite web|url=http://www.guide2womenleaders.com/Ghana.htm |title=Ghana Ministers |accessdate=2007-04-10 |date=31 May 2010 |work=Worldwide Guide to Women in Leadership |author=Martin K. I. Christensen |publisher=Martin K. I. Christensen}} Aryee is the founder and currently Executive Director of Salt & Light Ministries, a para-church organization. She also runs the Joyce Aryee CONSULT, which focuses in the areas of Management and Communications. She serves as a Board Member on several boards such as the Kinross Chirano Gold Mine Ghana board, the Mentoring Women Ghana board, and the Roman Ridge School Academic board. Aryee serves as the chair of [[Harmonious Chorale]], a music group in Ghana.{{Cite news|url=https://thebftonline.com/2017/lifestylesports/harmonious-chorale-marks-10th-anniversary/|title=Harmonious Chorale marks 10th anniversary - Business & Financial Times Online|date=2017-11-11|work=Business & Financial Times Online|access-date=2018-06-19|language=en-US}} ==Awards and honors== Aryee was given the Second Highest State Award, the Companion of the [[Order of the Volta]] in 2006 in recognition of her service to the nation. She is also the recipient of the [[Chartered Institute of Marketing Ghana|Chartered Institute of Marketing]], Ghana (CIMG), Marketing Woman of the Year Award for 2007 and the African Leadership on Centre for Economic Development's African Female Business Leader of the Year Award for 2009.{{Cite news|url=https://www.graphic.com.gh/news/general-news/superwoman-award-on-mother-s-day.html|title=Superwoman Award on Mother’s Day|last=Quansah|first=Hadiza Nuhhu-Billa|work=Graphic Online|access-date=2018-06-19|language=en-gb}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.newsghana.com.gh/profile-on-speakers-for-youth-revolution-conference/|title=Profile On Speakers For Youth Revolution Conference {{!}} News Ghana|website=www.newsghana.com.gh|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-19}} Aryee is an Honorary Fellow of the Ghana Institution of Engineers and received an Honorary Doctorate from the University of Mines and Technology in recognition of her immense contributions to the growth of the mining industry.[http://www.glicogen.com/about-glico-general/profile/profile-of-board/board-member-dr-mrs-joyce-aryee "Board Member, Dr. Mrs. Joyce Aryee"], Glico General. [[Achimota School]] named their 17th dormitory, 'Rev Joyce R. Aryee House' after her, in honor of her selfless service to the nation and commitment as well as contribution to her alma mater.{{Cite news|url=http://www.graphic.com.gh/news/general-news/achimota-school-names-girls-dormitory-after-rev-joyce-aryee.html|title=Achimota School names girls’ dormitory after Rev. Joyce Aryee - Graphic Online {{!}} Ghana News|last=Boateng|first=Dennis Agyei|newspaper=Graphic Online|language=en-GB|access-date=2017-01-23}} ==Publications== Aryee has co-authored the book ''The Transformed Mind''[https://www.amazon.com/The-Transformed-Mind-Samuel-Koranteng-Pipim-ebook/dp/B008EK0IKK The Transformed Mind''] (Eagle Online Books, 2012). Amazon. with Samuel Koranteng-Pipim. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.mwghana.org/en/index.php/about-us/board-members/ Mentoring Women Ghana Board] *[http://www.saltandlightgh.org/ Salt and Light Ministries website] {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{s-bef|before=}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Provisional National Defence Council|Minister for Information]]|years=1982 – 1985}} {{s-aft|after=}} {{s-bef|before=}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Minister for Education]]|years=1985 – 1987}} {{s-aft|after=}} {{s-bef|before=}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Provisional National Defence Council|Minister for Local Government]] |years=1987 – 1988}} {{s-aft|after=}} {{s-end}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Aryee, Joyce}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1947 births]] [[Category:Alumni of Achimota School]] [[Category:Ghanaian businesspeople]] [[Category:Ghanaian religious leaders]] [[Category:Education ministers of Ghana]] [[Category:Information ministers of Ghana]] [[Category:Local government ministers of Ghana]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the Volta]] [[Category:20th-century Ghanaian politicians]] [[Category:20th-century women politicians]] [[Category:21st-century Ghanaian politicians]] [[Category:21st-century women politicians]] [[Category:Women government ministers of Ghana]]

{{Orphan|date=May 2012}}
{{Infobox person |name = Juan Mauricio Wurmser |image = Juan-mauricio-wurmser.jpg |image_size = 200px |alt = |caption = Juan Mauricio Wurmser (1997) |birth_name = Juan Mauricio Wurmser |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |body_discovered = |death_cause = |resting_place = |resting_place_coordinates = |residence = |nationality = [[Guatemalteco]] {{GUA}} |ethnicity = |citizenship = |other_names = |known_for = |education = B.S. en [[Administración de Empresas]] en el [[The College of New Jersey|College of New Jersey]] |alma_mater = |employer = |occupation = [[Marketing]] |years_active = |home_town = |salary = |networth = |height = |weight = |title = |term = |predecessor = |successor = |party = |opponents = |boards = |religion = |spouse = |partner = |children = |parents = |relations = |callsign = |awards = |signature = |website = [http://www.laagenciamasefectiva.com Wurmser Ogilvy & Mather] |footnotes = |box_width = }}
'''Juan Mauricio Wurmser''' is a founding partner, President and [[CEO]] of [[Wurmser Ogilvy & Mather]], the O&M advertising firm in [[Guatemala]]. He is also founding partner and [[Chairman of Hill + Knowlton Strategies]] [[Guatemala]], the local subsidiary of this international public relations firm. He is a member of the Ogilvy Latina Executive Committee where he represents the Central American and Caribbean operations. Mr. Wurmser is involved in other business ventures in the marketing services and communications areas that include 141 Soho Square, MEC, Mindshare and Mediacom, all part of the WPP Group. He has more than 30 years of experience in the marketing of consumer goods throughout Latin America and a history of active participation in business chambers and organizations, as well as a spell of public service with the government of [[Guatemala]] .
==Prior History== Prior to joining WO&M and [[Hill and Knowlton]] [[Guatemala]] in mid-1998, Mr. Wurmser served as [[Minister of Economy]] of [[Guatemala]]. He was responsible for trade and industry promotion - with special emphasis on attracting foreign investment - and coordinated the regional and [[world|global]] economic integration efforts of the [[Arzú]] administration. He was a key member of the [[Guatemala]]n Economic Cabinet and sat on the Monetary Board where monetary, credit and exchange policies were defined. He was also Chairman of the Board of Governors of the [[Central American]] [[Bank of Economic]] Integration between 1997 and 1998.
Before taking up public service, Mr. Wurmser was responsible for developing and implementing the franchise program of [[Pollo Campero]], one of the most successful fast food restaurant chains in [[Central America]], which led to its [[international]] expansion.
His years as a corporate [[marketing]] executive include early assignments with the [[Guatemala]] subsidiaries of Warner Lambert, Avon, and [[Colgate-Palmolive]], before joining British American Tobacco in 1978, a company that he served for 15 years in [[Guatemala]], [[Panama]], [[Spain]], [[Mexico]], and [[Argentina]] before returning to [[Guatemala]] as President and General Manager of its local subsidiary.
Juan Mauricio has been committed to fostering Guatemala' s viability through his participation in business chambers and organisations through the years.
More recently, he was chosen by The Guatemalan Management Association as CEO of the Year 2015, one of the most coveted awards of the regional business community, followed by the early 2016 recognition as Guatemala's Entrepreneur of the Year by the Central American edition of The Economist magazine.
In mid 2016, affiliation agreements were signed by the Wurmser Communications Group with MEC and Mindshare, two of the global premier Media Investment Management companies, thus expanding further the WPP Group footprint in Guatemala and the Central American region.
==Other information== A native of Guatemala [[City]], Mr. Wurmser holds a B.S. in business administration from [[The College of New Jersey]] (formerly Trenton State College) and also attended the graduate school of business of [[Universidad Francisco Marroquín]] in [[Guatemala]].
Mr. Wurmser has been a member of the Board of Directors of the Chamber of Industry of [[Guatemala]], was Chairman of the Business Chamber of [[Guatemala]] in 1993 and also sat on the Board of Directors of the [[American Chamber of Commerce]] of [[Guatemala]] ([[AMCHAM]]) in 2009. He has been a board member of the [[Guatemala]]n [[Advertising Association]] ([[UGAP]]) over the years, having chaired it in 2001 and in 2013-2014. At present, he is also a member of the [[Board of Trustees]] of the [[Guatemala]] Development Foundation ([[FUNDESA]]) .
==External links== New Board of Directors 2009, AmCham [http://www.amchamguate.com/index.php?showPage=763&show=1]
H&K sets up in Guatemala as private industry booms, PR Week [https://web.archive.org/web/20120819213924/http://www.brandrepublic.com/News/106490/INTERNATIONAL-NEWS-H-K-sets-Guatemala-private-industry-booms/?DCMP=ILC-BETASEARCH]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Wurmser, Juan Mauricio}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Guatemalan businesspeople]] [[Category:Universidad Francisco Marroquín alumni]]

'''Karan Singh Thakral''' is an [[entrepreneur]] and an active member of [[Singapore]]’s business society.
==Business career== Thakral is currently an Executive Director of the multi-billion dollar Thakral Group.<ref>http://www.thakralone.com/whythakral</ref>
In 1975, Thakral established a consumer electronics division of his family business in [[Singapore]] and expanded its network to other countries in [[Southeast Asia]] and the [[Middle East]]. In 1981, he established the Distribution of Consumer Electronics business of the Thakral Group in [[Hong Kong]], ultimately leading to the creation of [[Thakral Corporation Ltd]], a separate company listed on the [[Singapore Exchange|Singapore Stock Exchange]].<ref>[http://angelsgate.com/tv/angels/karan Karan Singh Thakral], angelsgate.com, retrieved 31 March 2013.</ref> Thakral was also responsible for the development of the textile division of the Thakral Group.<ref>[http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=28439652&ticker=GIVO:IN&previousCapId=20343609&previousTitle=GIVO%20LTD Executive Profile - Karan Singh Thakral], Bloomberg Businessweek, retrieved 31 March 2013.</ref>
Thakral has also served as Chairman of the Singapore Business Federation's South Asia Business Group, Chairman of the Singapore Chapter of [[TiE]], and President of the International [[Punjabi people|Punjabi]] Chamber of Service Industry.<ref>[http://www.bansea.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=118&Itemid=189 Karan Singh Thakral], Business Angel Network South East Asia, retrieved 31 March 2013.</ref>
==Television work== Thakral served as one of the judges on the reality TV series ''Angel's Gate'', which began broadcasting on Channel NewsAsia in February 2012. The show gives budding entrepreneurs in [[Asia]] an opportunity to pitch business ideas to investors.
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Thakral, Karan Singh}} [[Category:Singaporean businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Singaporean people of Indian Punjabi descent]]

The '''Kroll process''' is a [[pyrometallurgical]] industrial process used to produce metallic [[titanium]]. It was invented in 1940 by [[William J. Kroll]] in [[Luxembourg]]. After moving to the United States, Kroll further developed the method for the production of [[zirconium]]. The Kroll process replaced the [[Hunter process]] for almost all commercial production.<ref>Holleman, A. F.; Wiberg, E. "Inorganic Chemistry" Academic Press: San Diego, 2001. {{ISBN|0-12-352651-5}}.</ref>
==Process== Prior to the Kroll process, [[titanium]] is separated from its ores by the [[chloride process]]. For this process, the feedstock consists of refined [[rutile]] or [[ilmenite]]. This mixture reduced with petroleum-derived coke in a [[fluidized bed reactor]] at 1000 °C. The resulting mixture is then treated with [[chlorine]] gas, affording TiCl<sub>4</sub> and other volatile chlorides, which are subsequently separated by continuous [[fractional distillation]]:<ref>{{Greenwood&Earnshaw2nd}}</ref> :<chem>FeTiO3 + C -> Fe + TiO2 + CO</chem> :<chem>TiO2 + 2C + 2Cl2 -> TiCl4 + 2CO</chem>
In the Kroll process, the TiCl<sub>4</sub> is reduced by liquid magnesium at 800–850 °C in a [[stainless steel]] retort to ensure complete reduction:<ref>Habashi, F. (ed.) Handbook of Extractive Metallurgy, Wiley-VCH, Weinheim, 1997.</ref><ref name=Ullmann>{{cite encyclopedia|authors=Heinz Sibum, Volker Günther, Oskar Roidl, Fathi Habashi, Hans Uwe Wolf|title=Titanium, Titanium Alloys, and Titanium Compounds|encyclopedia=Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry|year=2005|publisher=Wiley-VCH|location=Weinheim|doi=10.1002/14356007.a27_095}}</ref>
:<chem>TiCl4 + 2Mg -> Ti + 2MgCl2</chem>
Complications result from partial reduction of the TiCl<sub>4</sub>, giving to the lower chlorides [[Titanium(II) chloride|TiCl<sub>2</sub>]] and [[Titanium(III) chloride|TiCl<sub>3</sub>]]. The [[magnesium chloride|MgCl<sub>2</sub>]] can be further refined back to magnesium. <!-- seems too detailed an inexplicable as well given the subsequent text "After several days, so commented out: reaction stops, the pressure rises, and the spongy titanium is crushed and melted into an [[ingot]].--> The resulting porous metallic titanium sponge is purified by [[Tank leaching|leaching]] or heated [[vacuum distillation]]. The sponge is jackhammered out, crushed, and pressed before it is melted in a consumable carbon electrode vacuum [[Electric arc furnace|arc furnace]]. The melted [[ingot]] is allowed to solidify under [[vacuum]]. It is often remelted to remove inclusions and ensure uniformity. These melting steps add to the cost of the product. Titanium is about six times as expensive as stainless steel.
In the [[Hunter process]], which is not commercial, the TiCl<sub>4</sub> from the chloride process is reduced to the metal by sodium.<ref name=Ullmann/>
==History and subsequent developments== Many methods have been applied to the production of titanium metal, beginning with a report in 1887 by Nilsen and Pettersen using sodium, which was optimized into the commercial [[Hunter process]]. In the 1920s van Arkel had described the thermal decomposition of [[titanium tetraiodide]] to give highly pure titanium. Titanium tetrachloride was found to reduce with [[hydrogen]] at high temperatures to give hydrides that can be thermally processed to the pure metal. With this background, Kroll developed both new reductants and new apparatus for the reduction of titanium tetrachloride. Its high reactivity toward trace amounts of water and other metal oxides presented challenges. Significant success came with the use of [[calcium]] as a reductant, but the resulting still contained significant oxide impurities.<ref>W. Kroll “Verformbares Titan und Zirkon” (Eng: Ductile Titanium and Zirconium) Zeitschrift für anorganische und allgemeine Chemie Volume 234, p. 42-50. {{DOI|10.1002/zaac.19372340105}}</ref> Major success using [[magnesium]] at 1000 °C using a molybdenum clad reactor, as reported to the Electrochemical Society in Ottawa.<ref>W. J. Kroll, “The Production of Ductile Titanium” Transactions of the Electrochemical Society volume 78 (1940) 35–47.</ref> Kroll's titanium was highly ductile reflecting its high purity. The Kroll process displaced the Hunter process and continues to be the dominant technology for the production of titanium metal, as well as driving the majority of the world's production of magnesium metal.
Other technologies are competing with the Kroll process. One process involves [[electrolysis]] of a [[molten salt]]. Problems with this process include "redox recycling," the failure of the diaphragm, and dendritic deposition in the electrolyte solution. Another process, the [[FFC Cambridge process]],<ref>{{cite journal |author1=G. Z. Chen |author2=D. J. Fray |author3=T. W. Farthing | title = Direct Electrochemical Reduction of Titanium Dioxide to Titanium in Molten Calcium Chloride | journal = [[Nature (journal)|Nature]] | year = 2000 | volume = 407 | pages = 361–4 | doi = 10.1038/35030069 | pmid = 11014188 | issue = 6802|bibcode = 2000Natur.407..361C }}</ref> has been patented for a solid electrolytic solution, and its implementation would eliminate the titanium-sponge processing. Also in development is a pyrometallurgical route that involves the reduction of an intermediate form of titanium with aluminium. It combines the advantages of pyrometallurgy and a cheap reductant.
==See also== * [[Chloride process]]
==References== <references/>
==Further reading== * P.Kar, Mathematical modeling of phase change electrodes with application to the FFC process, PhD thesis; UC, Berkeley, 2007.
==External links== * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oWyrzZh3We0 Titanium: Kroll Method]: YouTube video uploaded by Innovations in Manufacturing at [[Oak Ridge National Laboratory]]
<!-- Categories --> [[Category:Industrial processes]] [[Category:Chemical processes]] [[Category:Zirconium]] [[Category:Titanium]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Nicolas Berggruen | image = 05082012Globalgovernance073(cropped).jpg | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1961|08|10|df=yes}} | birth_place= Paris, France | occupation = Investor and Philanthropist | networth = {{steady}}[[US Dollar|$]]2.0 [[1,000,000,000 (number)|billion]]
(February 2018)[https://www.forbes.com/profile/nicolas-berggruen/ Forbes The World's Billionaires: Nicolas Berggruen] September 2013 | alma_mater = [[New York University]] | website = [http://www.berggruen.org Official site] | parents = [[Heinz Berggruen]]
[[Bettina Moissi]] | nationality = Germany, United States | religion = | spouse = | children = | salary = | signature = }} '''Nicolas Berggruen''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|b|ɜr|g|r|uː|n|,_|b|ɜr|ˈ|g|r|uː|ən}};[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FAUNOL_d8YM&t=8s "Nicolas Berggruen on 'Giving Pledge' and think tanks"]; [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DHyReesbTFI&t=5s "Investing in Ideas: CNN Interview with Nicolas Berggruen"]. born 10 August 1961) is a philanthropist and investor. A dual American and German citizen,Jeremy Kahn (October 25, 2011), [https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-10-25/billionaire-living-out-of-tote-bag-amasses-fortune-to-give-away.html Billionaire Living Out of Tote Bag Amasses Fortune to Give Away] ''[[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]]'' he is the founder and president of Berggruen Holdings, a private investment company and the [[Berggruen Institute]], a think tank that works on addressing governance issues as well as the cultures and philosophies behind political systems. Through the Berggruen Institute he is also a co-founder, with the Washington Post, of The WorldPost, a media publication dedicated to global issues.{{cite web|url=https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2014/01/25/with-some-investing-help-huffington-unveils-a-new-international-venture/|title=With Some Investing Help, Huffington Unveils a New International Venture|first=Michael J. de la|last=Merced|publisher=}} ==Education and business career== Berggruen was born in Paris, the son of art collector [[Heinz Berggruen]],[http://www.businessweek.com/articles/2012-09-27/deep-thoughts-with-the-homeless-billionaire Businessweek: "Deep Thoughts With the Homeless Billionaire" By Devin Leonard] September 27, 2012 and actress [[Bettina Moissi]]. His father was of [[German-Jewish]] descent and his mother a [[Catholic]][http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/print/d-52909367.html Der Spiegel: "Seinen Geist am Leben erhalten" by Ulrike Von Knöfel and Martin Doerry (in German)] ''"Meine Mutter ist katholisch, mein Vater jüdisch" / My mother is Catholic, my father is Jewish'' of [[German people|German]] and [[Italian/Albanian people|Italian/Albanian]] descent. Berggruen attended the École Alsacienne in Paris and [[Le Rosey]] in Switzerland, before completing a [[baccalauréat]] in Paris as a candidat libre in 1978.Stacy Meichtry (September 29, 2011), [https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424053111904836104576556982258399652#ixzz1qhloiCVU Man Without a Country] ''[[Wall Street Journal]]''.Jori Finkel (March 18, 2012), [http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/news/la-ca-nicolas-berggruen-20120318,0,1625885.story?page=1 Nicolas Berggruen explains why he intends to give art to LACMA] ''[[Los Angeles Times]]''. He worked as a trainee at [[London Merchant Securities]] in London, known today as LMS Capital Plc. He subsequently obtained a [[Bachelor of Science]] in Finance and International Business from [[New York University]] in 1981. He later worked for the investment company [[Robert Bass|Bass Brothers Enterprises]], in its real estate group.[https://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/10/billionaires-2010_Nicolas-Berggruen_EX9R.html Nicolas Berggruen] ''[[Forbes]]''. Between 1983 and 1987, Berggruen was a Principal at Jacobson and Co.{{cn|date=June 2017}} In New York, based on a trust fund worth about $250,000, Berggruen began buying real estate before moving on to stocks, bonds and a portfolio of private equity and venture funds as well as hedge funds. He founded Berggruen Holdings, Inc. in 1984 to act as investment adviser to a Berggruen family trust. In 1988, he and [[Julio Mario Santo Domingo, Jr.]] co-founded Alpha Investment Management, a [[hedge fund]] that was reportedly sold to [[Safra Bank]] in 2004.{{cite news|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/2/4eca9d52-1f55-11e0-8c1c-00144feab49a.html |title=Lunch with the FT: Nicolas Berggruen |work=[[Financial Times]] |first=Gillian |last=Tett | authorlink =Gillian Tett|date=14 January 2011 |accessdate=25 September 2011}} The press has referred to Berggruen as "the homeless billionaire", as at one point he lived in hotels and did not own a home.{{cite news |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/09/25/MNK21L6IF8.DTL |date=25 September 2011 |accessdate=2 October 2011 |last=Garofoli |first=Joe |title=Can billionaire Nicolas Berggruen fix California? |newspaper=[[San Francisco Chronicle]] |via=SFGate.com}}{{cite web|last1=Curwen|first1=Tom|title=On his Santa Monica mountaintop, a billionaire envisions lofty thoughts on politics and culture|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/california/la-me-nicolas-berggruen-think-tank-20160429-snap-story.html|website=L.A. Times|accessdate=1 May 2016}} ==Berggruen Institute== ===Berggruen Governance Center=== In 2010, Berggruen founded the [[Berggruen Institute]], a self-styled "think and action tank." Through the institute, he has launched several government reform projects including the 21st Century Council which is focused on global governance challenges, the [[Council for the Future of Europe]], to support work on [[European integration]] and the ''Think Long Committee for California'', a bipartisan effort focused on reforming California's system of governance.{{cite web |url=http://www.sacbee.com/2011/11/20/4065880/thinking-long-about-states-future.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-04-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120419020036/http://www.sacbee.com/2011/11/20/4065880/thinking-long-about-states-future.html |archivedate=2012-04-19 |df= }} In 2015, Berggruen announced the launch of the Berggruen Philosophy and Culture Center.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/16/arts/nicolas-berggruen-wants-to-bridge-the-east-west-gap.html|title=Nicolas Berggruen Wants to Bridge the East-West Gap|date=16 September 2015|work=The New York Times|accessdate=1 May 2016}} Berggruen is a co-author (with [[Nathan Gardels]]) of a book on political governance: ''[[Intelligent Governance for the 21st Century]]: A Middle Way Between West and East'', written with Nathan Gardels (Polity, 2012). The ''[[Financial Times]]'' named it as one of their "Best Books of 2012".[http://www.ft.com/cms/s/2/88bdb3c0-37cf-11e2-a97e-00144feabdc0.html Financial Times: "Best books of 2012"] December 3, 2012 ===Berggruen Philosophy and Culture Center=== In September 2015, Berggruen announced the launch of the Berggruen Institute's Philosophy and Culture Center. The Center includes a fellowship program between Chinese and American universities, an ideas contest, and an annual $1 million philosophy prize to be awarded by an international jury. ==Institutional affiliations== Berggruen is a member of the [[Council on Foreign Relations]],{{cite web|url=http://www.cfr.org/about/membership/roster.html?letter=B|title=Membership Roster|work=Council on Foreign Relations|accessdate=1 May 2016}} Director on the Board of the [[Pacific Council on International Policy]], a member of Foro Iberoamericano, a member of the [[Helena Group]], and a member of the Commission on Global Ethics and Citizenship. In 2013 he was appointed by Harvard's Center for European Studies as its first non-resident Senior Fellow,{{cite web |url=https://ces.fas.harvard.edu/files/front/BerggruenPressRelease.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-09-30 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131023061933/https://ces.fas.harvard.edu/files/front/BerggruenPressRelease.pdf |archivedate=2013-10-23 |df= }} and was named a member of the Brookings International Advisory Council and the NYU President's Global Council.{{cite web|url=http://www.brookings.edu/support-brookings/getting-involved/international-advisory-council|title=International Advisory Council|work=The Brookings Institution|accessdate=1 May 2016}} In 2014 he was named a member of the Leadership Council at [[John F. Kennedy School of Government|Harvard Kennedy School]]'s [[Center for Public Leadership]], a member of Harvard University's Global Advisory Council, as well as a trustee of the [[Asia Society]].{{cite web|url=http://asiasociety.org/about/trustees|title=Co-Chairs and Trustees|work=Asia Society|accessdate=1 May 2016}} He is also a member of the [[World Economic Forum]].{{cite web|url=http://www.weforum.org/contributors/nicolas-berggruen|title=Nicolas Berggruen - World Economic Forum|work=World Economic Forum|accessdate=1 May 2016}} ==Arts== Berggruen is the head of the Board of the [[Berggruen Museum]] in Berlin and a member of the [[Los Angeles County Museum of Art|Los Angeles County Museum]] (LACMA), the International Councils of the [[Tate Gallery]] in London, and the [[Museum of Modern Art]] in New York. He is also a member of the Beyeler Foundation, the International Council of the [[Serpentine Gallery]],{{cite web|url=http://www.serpentinegallery.org/support.html|title=Support|work=Serpentine Galleries|accessdate=1 May 2016}} and [[Sotheby's]] International Advisory Board.{{cite web|url=http://www.sothebys.com/en/inside/board-of-directors.html|title=Sotheby's - Board of Directors|work=sothebys.com|accessdate=1 May 2016}} In cooperation with LACMA, he has been making acquisitions intended for the museum. ==Philanthropy== Berggruen has committed to give the majority of his wealth through the Nicolas Berggruen Charitable Trust{{cite web|url=http://nicolasberggruentrust.com/|title=Home Page|work=nicolasberggruentrust.com|accessdate=1 May 2016}} and has joined [[The Giving Pledge]].http://givingpledge.org/pdf/letters/Berggruen_Letter.pdf Berggruen has endowed the Berggruen Institute with $500 Million to further the activities and broaden its global reach.{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-05-04/-homeless-billionaire-gets-l-a-welcome-after-500-million-gift|title=`Homeless Billionaire' Charms L.A. With $500 Million Gift|last=chrispalmeri|first=Christopher Palmeri|website=Bloomberg.com|access-date=2016-06-16}} Through Berggruen Holdings, Berggruen was a primary investor and developer in Newark, New Jersey's [[Teachers Village (Newark)|Teachers Village]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.teachersvillage.com/team.html|title=Teachers Village {{!}} Team|website=www.teachersvillage.com|access-date=2016-06-16}} He was also honored by his alma mater, [[New York University Stern School of Business|NYU Stern]], at the 2016 Haskins Giving Society Award Dinner for his commitment to business and public service.{{Cite web|url=http://www.stern.nyu.edu/portal-partners/alumni/events/haskins-giving-society-award-dinner|title=NYU Stern {{!}} Haskins Giving Society Award Dinner|website=www.stern.nyu.edu|access-date=2016-06-16}} In 2018, he received the [[Ellis Island Medal of Honor]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.neco.org/medal-of-honor/2018-medalists|title=2018 Ellis Island Medal of Honor Recipients|website=www.neco.org|language=en|access-date=2018-05-13}} ==Personal life== Berggruen has two children, who were born from one egg-donor and two surrogates.[http://www.latimes.com/local/california/la-me-nicolas-berggruen-think-tank-20160429-snap-story.html Los Angeles Times: "On his Santa Monica mountaintop, a billionaire envisions lofty thoughts on politics and culture" by Thomas Curwen] April 30, 2016 His brother is the art historian [[Olivier Berggruen]]. ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://berggruen.org Official site] *[http://www.berggruenholdings.com Berggruen Holdings] *{{C-SPAN|Nicolas Berggruen}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Berggruen, Nicolas}} [[Category:1961 births]] [[Category:American billionaires]] [[Category:American investors]] [[Category:American businesspeople]] [[Category:American people of German-Jewish descent]] [[Category:German people of Albanian descent]] [[Category:German people of Austrian descent]] [[Category:Giving Pledgers]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Stern School of Business alumni]] [[Category:American people of Austrian descent]] [[Category:American people of Albanian descent]] [[Category:People from Paris]]
